meanings.definition: To render (an electronic device) inoperable, especially by accidentally damaging its firmware or software.
meanings.sent1: I bricked my phone by pressing the wrong buttons.
meanings.sent2: He bricked his computer when he spilled water on it.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally bricked her tablet by dropping it in the bathtub.
meanings.sent4: The power surge bricked the entire network, causing chaos.
meanings.sent5: The virus bricked the system, leaving it completely useless.

meanings.definition: To build or pave with bricks.
meanings.sent1: They bricked the patio to create a cozy outdoor space.
meanings.sent2: The mason bricked the fireplace beautifully.
meanings.sent3: The kids decided to brick a small pathway in the garden for fun.
meanings.sent4: The old house was bricked with red bricks, giving it a classic look.
meanings.sent5: The sidewalk was bricked meticulously, showcasing the craftsmanship.
